question_text: What is the role of a DNS root server in the name resolution process?
answer_options: It provides the final IP address for all domains
It stores full DNS zones for country-level domains
It directs the query to the correct Top-Level Domain (TLD) server
It only handles private internal domain queries
correct_answer: It directs the query to the correct Top-Level Domain (TLD) server
explanation: DNS root servers help initiate the resolution process by pointing to TLD servers like .com, .net, etc.
